00018 #include <stdio.h>
00019 #include <stdlib.h>
00020 #include <string.h>
00021 
00022 #include "cmime_address.h"
00023 
00024 /* Creates a new CMIMEAddress_T object */
00025 CMimeAddress_T *cmime_address_new(void) {
00026     CMimeAddress_T *ca;
00027     ca = (CMimeAddress_T *)calloc((size_t)1,sizeof(CMimeAddress_T));
00028     return(ca);
00029 }
00030 
00031 /* Set the display name of CMimeAdresse_T object */
00032 void cmime_address_set_name(CMimeAddress_T *ca, char *name) {
00033     ca->name = (char *)malloc(strlen(name) + 1);
00034     strcpy(ca->name,name);
00035 }
00036 
00037 /* Set the email address of CMimeAdresse_T object */
00038 void cmime_address_set_email(CMimeAddress_T *ca, char *email) {
00039     ca->email = (char *)malloc(strlen(email) + 1);
00040     strcpy(ca->email, email);
00041 }
00042 
00043 /* Allocates a string containing the contents of the CMimeAddress_T object. */ 
00044 char *cmime_address_to_string(CMimeAddress_T *ca) {
00045     char *s = NULL;
00046     asprintf(&s,"%s <%s>",ca->name,ca->email);
00047     
00048     return(s);
00049 }
00050 
00051 /* Parse given string and create CMimeAddress_T object */
00052 CMimeAddress_T *cmime_address_parse_string(char *s) {
00053     CMimeAddress_T *ca = cmime_address_new();
00054     
00055     return(ca);
00056 }
00057 
00058 /* Free used memory */
00059 void cmime_address_free(CMimeAddress_T *ca) {
00060     if (ca->name != NULL)
00061         free(ca->name);
00062     if (ca->email != NULL)
00063         free(ca->email);
00064     free(ca);
00065 }
